sn55.4:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn55.4:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Ānanda came out of solitude …
sn55.4:4.4: “Reverend, how many things do people have to possess in order for the Buddha to declare that they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening?”
sn55.4:4.5: “Reverend, people have to possess four things in order for the Buddha to declare that they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.4:5.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.4:5.7: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.4:5.9: People have to possess these four things in order for the Buddha to declare that they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
